bug.author: Lirrec
bug.summary: Runtime assertions of calib3d cv::calibrateCamera() in some cases misleading.
bug.description:
The runtime assertions of calibrateCamera() from the calib3d module may state misleading exception messages if one of the vectors given to calibrateCamera in the parameter imagePoints is empty. The exception is thrown in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/blob/f9e2b036a502309c0da5abc5e711d4cd64eb8a38/modules/calib3d/src/calibration.cpp#L3055>collectCalibrationData() Line 3055</denchmark-link> and will look like this <denchmark-code>OpenCV Error: Unsupported format or combination of formats (imagePoints1 should contain vector of vectors of points of type Point2f) in collectCalibrationData, file D:/dev/MINGW-packages/mingw-w64-opencv/src/opencv-3.1.0/modules/calib3d/src/calibration.cpp, line 3063 terminate called after throwing an instance of 'cv::Exception' what(): D:/dev/MINGW-packages/mingw-w64-opencv/src/opencv-3.1.0/modules/calib3d/src/calibration.cpp:3063: error: (-210) imagePoints1 should contain vector of vectors of points of type Point2f in function collectCalibrationData </denchmark-code>
stating that the types/content of the vector is in an invalid format, while the real problem is that one of the vectors inside imagePoints is empty, causing the checkVector in Line <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/blob/f9e2b036a502309c0da5abc5e711d4cd64eb8a38/modules/calib3d/src/calibration.cpp#L3053>3053</denchmark-link> to fail. Please add a separate error case and message that states that the vector is empty, before throwing wrong assertions about its contained type. The same case may also apply to the objectPoints Parameter. A more helpfull ( and less missleading ) error message may save someone else some precious debugging time.

comments.comment: +1 On this. Experienced the same situation. Thanks for putting this issue out.
+1. Please, I wasted 2 hours trying to find the error. Maybe, other users could save time not searching for the type Vector.
I'm working on a fix for this.
